desc: Students delve into advanced language work and on-the-spot investigation of French culture, past and present, including theater, film, visual arts, the French court, and the medieval cathedral through background readings and visits to important monuments. Students read, discuss, see, and critique plays ranging from the classical to the contemporary. Taught in French. Prerequisite: One French 250-level course (two recommended). Offered during Interim.
name: ID French Studies - Paris
notes: Open to all students who meet the prerequiistes. This is an off-campus course. You will find this course listed in Studio Abroad under its course title.
prerequisites: Prerequisite: One French 250-level course (two recommended). Offered during Interim.
title: Interdisciplinary French Studies in Paris
